Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Could Merlot be the true gem of the warmer areas of the Santa Cruz Mountains? This bottling says s, showing red cherry, woodpsice and minty herb aromas on the nose. The palate clings to a firm tannic frame, offering umami-laced flavors of soy, herb, red fruit and baking spice. Drink now-2032.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lexington 2019 Gist Ranch Estate Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)Cellar Selection

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: While the wine's raspberry, lilac and lemon aromas are pretty, its earthy petrichor/ozone note is hard to resist. Look for flavors like Bing cherries and lemonade mixed in with black tea, caramel, and rosemary. Firm tannins with a decent bit of acidity and rich mouthfeel.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Kludt Family 2019 Williams Vineyard Reserve Merlot (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine's blueberries, cherry blossom, lemon basil and honeycomb aromas make for a beautiful introduction. Flavors of cherry fruit leather, orange sorbet and black tea are rich and satisfying. This nicely balanced wine possesses a slippery mouthfeel, soft tannins and a long finish.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Canvasback 2019 Red Mountain Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A richly textured wine, with super floral aromas of lilac and wild roses joining black cherries, cedar and pipe tobacco. Lush, concentrated blackberry and dark plum flavors glide over the palate. This Merlot is hedonistic and enjoyable.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Luke 2020 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: There is already a good balance in this wine. Ripe tannins and black currant fruits co-exist easily with the overall smokiness of the wine. It shows potential. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-François Reaud 2020 Terre Océane  (Bordeaux Supérieur)Best Buy

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred cherry and fresh berry meet with roasted meat aromas on the nose of this bottling. There's a peppery spice to the palate, where black plum and purple flowers make for an easygoing sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Double Black 2021 Merlot (Paso Robles)Best Buy
